name: St. Alphonsa

locations.description: Syro-Malabar Catholic nun in Kerala, India

summary: Alphonsa was an Indian Syro-Malabar Catholic nun who is the first woman of Indian origin to be canonized. She lived a life of intense suffering and prayer, offering her sufferings for the conversion of sinners. Despite poor health and physical ailments, she maintained a joyful spirit and deep devotion to Jesus.
